abstract: Mormon style, once recognizable only for its clean-cut young missionaries in dark suits, is expanding to include more personal looks; as church pushes 'I'm a Mormon' ad campaign to promote its diversity, younger worshipers navigate the religion's dress codes so that they can both look hip to the outside world and acceptable to the church.
snippet: With its new “I’m a Mormon” ad campaign, the Mormon Church is seeking a more fashionable face. But some of what’s deemed cool these days — beards, scruffy clothes, tattoos — raises eyebrows.
